name: Create Draft Issue
description: Creates a new draft issue in the specified project. Draft issues visible only for the current user and can be edited using update_issue. Returns the created issue ID and URL to open in browser.

name: Create Issue
description: Creates a new issue in the specified project. Use get_issue_fields_schema to discover `customFields` and their possible values for the project. Important: some of the custom fields might be required to create an issue. Returns the created issue ID and URL. Use get_issue to get the full issue details.

project.description: Project key or ID where the issue will be created (e.g., DEMO).

description.description: Sets description in plain text or markdown.

customFields.description: Subset issue custom fields (key-value) to set. Pass the fields and their values that you want to set. Example: {"Type": "Task", "Priority": "Minor"}

parentIssue.description: Optional parent issue id or readable id. The new issue will be a subtask of the specified parent issue. Use only if the new issue is explicitly requested to be a subtask.

outputSchema.description: Result of creating an issue: created issue reference, optional parent reference, and outcome of applying custom fields.

url.description: Direct link to the created issue

parentIssue.description: Parent issue reference if the new issue was created as a subtask.

url.description: Direct link to the parent issue

errors.description: Errors encountered while applying custom fields (validation/permissions).

updatedFields.description: Issue fields that were successfully updated.

failedToUpdateFields.description: Requested fields that were not updated.

limit.description: Maximum number of items to return.

outputSchema.description: List of matching projects with minimal info to help select a project.

outputSchema.description: List of user groups or project teams matching the query.

membersCount.description: The number of users in the group/team

name: Manage Issue Tags
description: Adds or removes a tag from an issue. If a name is passed, adds the first matching tag by name. If tag not found, the returns error message with similar tags suggestions. Returns the issue ID and updated list of issue tags.

issueId.description: Id or readable id of the issue.

tag.description: Id (preferable) or name of the tag to add.

operation.description: Operation to perform: add or remove.

name: Update Issue
description:
Updates an existing issue and its fields (customFields). Pass any of the arguments to partially update the issue:
- 'summary' or 'description' arguments to update only the issue summary or description.
- 'customFields' argument as key-value JSON object to update issue fields like State, Type, Priority, etc. Use get_issue_fields_schema to discover 'customFields' and their possible values.
- 'parentIssue' argument to link current issue (issueId) as a subtask. Use only if the issue is explicitly requested to be a subtask.
- 'relatedIssue' argument to link current issue (issueId) as a related issue. Use only if the issue is explicitly requested to be a related issue.
- 'subscription' argument to subscribe (true) or unsubscribe (false) the current user from the issue updates. If subscribed, the user receives notification about the issue updates.
- 'vote' argument to vote (true) or unvote (false) the current user for the issue. If voted, the user receives notification about the issue updates.
Returns updated issue ID and the confirmation what was updated.

issueId.description: Issue or draft issue ID, e.g. PROJ-123, 3-42.

summary.description: New summary. When undefined, existing summary stays as is.

description.description: New description. When undefined, existing description stays as is.

customFields.description: Subset of issue custom fields to update. Pass only those fields and values that should updated, all the other existing issue fields will be left unchanged. Example: {"Type": "Task", "Priority": "Minor"}

name: Search Issues
description:
Searches issues using YouTrackâ€™s query language. The 'query' can combine attribute filters, keywords and free text. Examples of common patterns:

- Free text: Just type words to search in summary, description and comments. Use wildcards: '*' for any characters, '?' for single character (e.g., 'summary: log*', 'fix??'). Examples: 'login button bug', 'some other text', 'summary: log*', 'description: fix??'.
- Linked issues: '<linkType>: <issueId>'. Examples: 'relates to: DEMO-123', 'subtask of: DEMO-123' (issues where DEMO-123 is a parent). Hint: get_issue returns 'linkedIssueCounts' property which shows the available link types for the issue.
- Mentioned it issues: 'mentions: <issueId>'. Examples: 'mentions: DEMO-123'.
- Project filter: 'project: <ProjectName>'. Use project name or project key. Examples: 'project: {Mobile App}', 'project: MA'.
- Assignee filter: 'for: <login>'. Use 'me' for the currently authenticated user. Examples: 'for: me', 'for: john.smith'.
- Reporter filter: 'reporter: <username>'. Use 'me' for the currently authenticated user. Examples: 'reporter: me', 'reporter: admin'.
- Tag filter: 'tag: <TagName>'. Wrap multi-word tags in braces { }. Examples: 'tag: urgent', 'tag: {customer feedback}'.
- Field filter: '<FieldName>: <Value>'. For any project field, e.g., State, Type, Priority, etc. Wrap multi-word names or values in { }. Use get_project to get the possible fields and values for the project issues to search. Use '-' as 'not', e.g., 'State: -Fixed' filters out fixed issues. Examples: 'Priority: High', 'State: {In Progress}, Fixed' (searches issues with 'In Progress' state + issues with 'Fixed' state), 'Due Date: {plus 5d}' (issues that are due in five days).
- Date filters: 'created:', 'updated:', 'resolved date:' (or any date field) plus a date, range, or relative period. Relative periods: 'today', 'yesterday', '{This week}', '{Last week}', '{This month}', etc. Examples: 'created: {This month}', 'updated: today', 'resolved date: 2025-06-01 .. 2025-06-30', 'updated: {minus 2h} .. *' (issues updated last 2 hours), 'created: * .. {minus 1y 6M}' (issues that are at least one and a half years old).
- Keywords: '#Unresolved' to find unresolved issues based on the State; '#Resolved' to find resolved/finished issues.
- Combining filters: List multiple conditions separated by spaces (logical AND). For OR operator, add it explicitly. Examples: '(project: MA) and (for: me) and (created: {minus 8h} .. *) and runtime error' (issues in project MA and assigned to currently authenticated user and created during last 8h and contains 'runtime error' text), '(Type: Task and State: Open) or (Type: Bug and Priority: Critical)'.

Returns basic info: id, summary, project, resolved, reporter, created, updated. For full details, use get_issue. Response is paginated via offset and limit.

limit.description: Maximum number of issues to return.

outputSchema.description: List of issues that match the given YouTrack search query (basic fields).

project.description: Project key the issue belongs to

reporter.description: Login of the issue reporter (if visible)

resolvedAt.description: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss or null if not resolved

updatedAt.description: Last update timestamp in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss
